title.rendered: “IAF Strikes Hezbollah Targets in Lebanon: Aerial Assault and Interception Update”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Documentation: Fighter jets attacked terrorist infrastructure used by the aerial division of the Hezbollah terrorist organization deep in Lebanon; a suspicious aerial target was intercepted after crossing into Israeli territory from Lebanon.

In recent hours, IAF fighter jets attacked several terrorist infrastructures of the Hezbollah terrorist organization in the areas of Aitaroun, Bleidah, and Maroun al-Ras. Additionally, earlier today, IAF fighter jets struck a terrorist infrastructure in the Baalbek area used by Hezbollah’s air defense system.

Following the alert about the infiltration of hostile aircraft in northern Israel earlier today, air defense fighters successfully intercepted a suspicious aerial target that crossed into Israeli territory from Lebanon; there were no casualties.

Furthermore, in response to alerts about rocket and missile fire in northern Israel a short while ago, this was a false identification.

Attached is documentation from the strike in Baalbek: https://bit.ly/4bcsZbD

Attached is documentation from the interception: https://bit.ly/45CeM6C

Attached is documentation from the attacks: https://bit.ly/4bjinrx
